intro: Microseris scapigera, commonly known as the scapigerous tansy, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the western United States and grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and linear. It has a short, unbranched stem with a basal rosette of leaves. Microseris scapigera is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
